intro: Seidenfia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seidenfia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Seidenfia lancifolia is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
